did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle:
Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer
1950-1997
1970-1990

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in Tlingit and English

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Nora Marks Dauenhauer, of Yakutat and Tlingit heritage, along with her husband Richard Dauenhauer, recorded hundreds of personal narratives during the 1960s to the 1980s. Nora was one of a group of Tlingit women who undertook language revitalization during the same period. The collection consists of interviews with Tlingit language speakers in Alaska. The bulk of the recordings were made between the 1960s to the 1980s, some in the 1950s, a few are copies of field recordings made by Frederica de Laguna (1950s) and John Swanton (1904). Through personal narratives, songs, and stories, these tradition bearers impart knowledge about inter-tribal relationships and relationships with outside communities, economic life, medicine, fishing, religious expression, and other aspects of community life.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer collection was transferred to Alice Taff and Kathy Kolkhorst Ruddy (English executor).

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer was processed by Maya Lerman in 2020-2021.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p:
Finding aid
for Dauenhauer Tlingit Oral Literature collection at Sealaska Heritage Institute.

separatedmaterial.head: Other Repositories
separatedmaterial.p: Sealaska Heritage Institute contains significant manuscript materials of Nora and Richard Daenhauer, as well as the Dauenhauer Tlingit Oral Literature collection of approximately 500 audio recordings on CD. There may be overlapping materials with AFC's collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions. All rights lie with the Tlingit clans and/or individuals of origin.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer collection is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer (AFC 2019/004), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Born May 8, 1927, Nora Marks Dauenhauer was a Tlingit poet, writer, and Tlingit language scholar. Her husband, Richard Daunhauer, was an American linguist, professor, and poet, and became an advocate for the Tlingit language. From 2012 to 2014 Nora was the Alaska States Poet Laureate, and Richard was Poet Laureate of Alaska from 1981 to 1988. Nora and Richard recorded hundreds of personal narratives of Tlingit elders and others in the community. These recordings document Tlingit history, language, traditions, and subsistence through oral history, gatherings, and cultural programs. The Dauenhauers worked and were affiliated with Sealaska Heritage Institute (SHI) and published numerous books including coediting SHI's Classics of Tlingit Oral Literature series together.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of interviews with Tlingit language speakers in Alaska and recordings from Tlingit gatherings and events. The bulk of the recordings were made between the 1960s to the 1980s, some in the 1950s, a few are copies of field recordings made by Frederica de Laguna (1950s) and John Swanton (1904). Through personal narratives, songs, and stories, these tradition bearers impart knowledge about inter-tribal relationships and relationships with outside communities, economic life, medicine, fishing, religious expression, and other aspects of community life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Tlingit songs and texts collected by Nora Marks Dauenhauer and Richard Dauenhauer collection is organized into the following series:
Arranged according to the numbering system kept by the Dauenhauers, labeled on the tapes upon donation to AFC. This numbering is reflected in the Original Tape IDs.
The quotation marks in the item-level descriptions of contents indicate that the notes were drawn directly from the collector documentation.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of interviews with Tlingit language speakers in Alaska. The bulk of the recordings were made between 1960s to the 1980s, some in the 1950s, a few are copies of field recordings made by Frederica de Laguna (1950s) and John Swanton (1904). Through personal narratives, songs, and stories, these tradition bearers impart knowledge about inter-tribal relationships and relationships with outside communities, economic life, medicine, fishing, religious expression, and other aspects of community life. Descriptions, including speakers' names, moieties, crests, clans, and other descriptive information about the recordings come from documentation provided by donor.

Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska (Cedar House). Recorded by: Lil White. Description of contents: Chookaneidí songs from Naanaahít and Bear House, Hoonah.

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Kaax'achgóok; Raven & Gull; Raven and Water; Raven and Fire; Raven and Tide; Raven and Whale. These stories are transcribed for Raven Book.

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Tl'anaxéedakw (Lady of Auke Lake), Xakúch' (man who killed the Giant Devil Fish aka Octopus).

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Story of Guxk'w Sákw, Guxk'w Sákw and his song. Relatives of Eliza Marks, T'akdeintaan. Xakw Chookan Heen and T'ooch'/gold. Raven and the Sun, Moon, and Stars. Tl'anaxéedakw.

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Side 1. Willie Marks at Mt. Edge Cumbe.; David Kadashan at Sitka. Continuation of Guxk'w Sákw. Side 2. David Kadashan of Guxk'w Sákw continued; Ida Kadashan, Yeik.

Speaker's English name: Willie and Emma Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí (Willie), Seigeigéi (Emma). Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle) (Willie), Yéil (Raven) (Emma). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear) (Willie), Gaat (Sockeye) (Emma). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah) (Willie), L'ukaax.ádi (Dry Bay) (Emma). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Willie and Emma talk about proverbs. Bear Husband. Xakúch'.

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Story of Yuwaan Gagéets. Ending of a potlatch song, from Hoonah, Alaska.

Speaker's English name: Amy Marvin. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kooteen. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Interview about Glacier Bay (Alaska).

Speaker's English name: Austin Hammond. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Daanawáak. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: Lukaax.ádi (Haines). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Portland, Oregon. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Raven and his Nose [This tape excerpt is copied from the Rasmussen Conference set].

Speaker's English name: Jim Fox. Speaker's Tlingit Name: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Carol Beery Davis. Description of contents: Interview. [Nora copied Mrs Davis's original on 23 August 1972].

Speaker's English name: A.P. Johnson; Forest Dewitt. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Ixt'ik' Eesh; Hinwantáax'. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven); Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Xíxch' (Frog); Téel' (Dog Salmon). Speaker's Clan: Kiks.ádi (Sitka); L'eineidí (Juneau). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan; unknown. Language: English/Tlingit; Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska; Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: A.P. Johnson speech about lifestyle, beliefs, culture, religion; Forest Dewitt speech.

Speaker's English name: A.P. Johnson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Ixt'ik' Eesh. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Xíxch' (Frog). Speaker's Clan: Kiks.ádi (Sitka). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Rosita and Bob Worl. Description of contents: Rambling.

Speaker's English name: A.P. Johnson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Ixt'ik' Eesh. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Xíxch' (Frog). Speaker's Clan: Kiks.ádi (Sitka). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Speaker's English name: A.P. Johnson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Ixt'ik' Eesh. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Xíxch' (Frog). Speaker's Clan: Kiks.ádi (Sitka). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Begins with modern times Tlingits. Then a story about Kooshda.

Speaker's English name: George Dalton. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Stoowukáa;Kaadéik. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Gooch (Wolf). Speaker's Clan: Kaagwaantaan (Sitka). Father's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Ken Austin. Description of contents: Story.

Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Inaudible.

Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Inaudible; Listing traditional T'akdeintaan houses in Hoonah. He's talking about At.oow, and that you have to take care of it. He talks about the snail house, arctic turns. He sings the mountain dog hat song as well. He tells story "To Be a Slave" (Guxk'w Sákw).

Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Listing traditional Chookaneidí houses in Hoonah. He talks about the small pox epidemic. He also talks about when school's just began. He tells clan stories, and how they made boats.

Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Tells how Haidas had gotten to the Alaska mainland. And how the Tlingits learned how to build boats.

Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Speaker's English name: David Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaatyé. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Shangukeidí. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Discussing song Kaax'achgóok. Sings Interior Indian Songs.

Speaker's English name: Ida Kadashan. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaashtunaa. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Thunderbird. Speaker's Clan: Shangukeidí. Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: unknown. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Interview with Ida Kadashan.

Speaker's English name: Harry Bremner. Speaker's Tlingit Name: unknown. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Humpy Salmon. Speaker's Clan: K'waashk'i Kwaan. Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Yakutat, Alaska. Recorded by: SNEP. Description of contents: History of Yakutat tape 1 side 1 recorded 12-31-64. Handwriting on the box and cassetter look like Andy Hope's. The original was probably made by Frederica de Laguna. There are probably copies of the originals in the SHI archives.

Speaker's English name: Harry Bremner. Speaker's Tlingit Name: unknown. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Humpy Salmon. Speaker's Clan: K'waashk'i Kwaan. Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Yakutat, Alaska. Recorded by: SNEP. Description of contents: History of Yakutat Tape 2. Recorded 12-31-64. Handwriting on the box looks like Andy Hope's. The original was probably made by Frederica de Lagauna. There are probably copies or originals in the SHI archives.

Speaker's English name: Frank Italio. Speaker's Tlingit Name: unknown. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Thunderbird. Speaker's Clan: Shangukeidí. Father's Clan: L'uknax.adi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Yakutat, Alaska. Recorded by: Fredercia de Laguna. Description of contents: Frank is talking about raven and the whale. He is talking about box of daylight. Bird that dances on the edge of the river. *added by Kaawus.aa* Lk'ayaak' man that did 'crazy' things, he was unorthodox and hyperactive.

Description of contents: This is a copy of the original recording by Frederica de Laguna, Yakutat, July 30, 1952. Card insert notes Nora Dauenhauer audit time of November 29, 1999. Contents: 1 Maker of Thunderbird Screen, K'washnáa; 2, Sit' aayí, thunderbird song in athabaskan; 3 Interpretation, the handling of at.óow; 4 Thunderbird screen and song and interpretation of use; 5, interruption; 6, explanation by de Laguna.

The box labeled GD.01 in the series does not contain a tape of George Davis, but something unrelated.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: George Davis interview about raven, about the different seasons, about the illnesses that people are getting today, and about Tlingit medicine.

Speaker's English name: George Davis; Austin Hammond. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Daanawáak. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven; Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver); Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon); L'ukaax.ádi(Haines). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan; Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Austin Hammond talking with George Davis about they way they lived, the Chinook language, and the first schooner that came to Sitka. George talks about Tlingit land and how decisions concerning the land are do not include Tlingit people. George talks about medicine, and Kooshdaa Kwaáni.

Speaker's English name: George Davis; Austin Hammond. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Daanawáak. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven; Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver); Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon); L'ukaax.ádi(Haines). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan; Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Tape 2, recorded by Nora Dauenhauer at Sealaska Heritage Foundation in Juneau. George talks about the growth of salmon, and about Lukaax.ádi land.

Speaker's English name: Austin Hammond. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Daanawáak. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: L'ukaax.ádi (Haines). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: George Davis and Austin Hammond recorded by Nora Dauenhauer at Sealaska Heritage Foundation in Juneau.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: George Davis interview.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: tape 2. Recorded at Sealaska Heritage Foundation. George Davis discussing the skinning trade, the Angoon battle, whaling at Killisnoow, and the burning of Angoon. Davis talks about At.óow that was sold, and how the Frog house began. He tells about how 10 Aleuts came to fight with Kaagwaantaan. He sings a Beaver song, and explains how the Kaagwaantaan crest is the Beaver, as is the Deishitaan.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: tape 3. Recorded at Sealaska Heritage Foundation. George talks about fighting on the reef, Daax haat kanadaa, located by Angoon, and discusses how the peacemakers are made.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: tape 1. Recorded at Sealaska Heritage Foundation. George talks about migration from the interior to Haines area, on foot, from Duncan canal. He tells of the flood, and how they were displaced by the glacier. Eva tells of a girl who taught the bird to say Choo-ka-nei-di. George tells of his fishing on the boat Gypsy at Homeshore, as well as stories involving animals. Nora and George discuss sexism in the village and stories involving shamans.

Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: tape 2. Recorded at Sealaska Heritage Foundation. Conversation about every day things, such as health and work.

Speaker's English name: Jimmie George. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Wóochx Kaduhaa. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Kéet (Killer Whale). Speaker's Clan: Dakl'aweidí (Angoon). Father's Clan: Deisheetaan yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Naatsilanéi - Killer Whale story. A story of how one man became a Shaman in Tsaagwáa (a place).

Speaker's English name: Johnny C. Jackson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Gooch Éesh; Naakil.aan. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: Kaach.ádi (Kake). Father's Clan: Sit'kweidí yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Mt. Edgecumbe Hospital, Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Kaach.ádi and Lukaax.ádi separation. Last few minutes of recording is a little messed up.

Speaker's English name: Johnny C. Jackson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Gooch Éesh; Naakil.aan. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Gaat (Sockeye). Speaker's Clan: Kaach.ádi (Kake). Father's Clan: Sit'kweidí yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Mt. Edgecumbe Hospital, Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Continuation of history and story, history of North Pass. He tells of the story of the Hoonah Seagull. He sings Tlingit entrance and exit songs in Tsimpshian.

Speaker's English name: Andrew Johnny. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Deitxoon. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Cheech (Porpoise). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Sumdum Bay and North Pass. Andrew tells of how they would sleep in their boat in Sumdum Bay and of "real men." He tells of the giant Devil Fish (octopus), the giant rat, and the underwater beetle (or crab?) which was four feet long.

Speaker's English name: J.B. Fawcett; Charlie Joseph. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Tseexwáa; Kaal.átk'. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle); Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Toos' (Shark); Gooch (Wolf). Speaker's Clan: Wooshkeetaan (Hoonah); unknown. Father's Clan: T'akdeintaa; unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Katherine Mills. Description of contents: first recorded onto open reel tape (1968), and then transferred to cassette on 2/25/1999. Shark House Potlatch in Hoonah, Alaska.

Speaker's English name: Jessie Dalton. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Daax'wudaak; Naa Tláa. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: Kittiwake. Speaker's Clan: T'akdeintaan. Father's Clan: Wooshkeetaan. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Hoonah, Alaska. Recorded by: Horace Marks and/or Johnny Marks. Description of contents: first recorded onto open reel tape (1968), and then transferred to cassette. Continuation of SR134. Shark House Potlatch in Hoonah, Alaska.

Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Joking and fun making. Recording is poor.

Speaker's English name: J.B. Fawcett. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Tseexwáa. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Toos' (Shark). Speaker's Clan: Wooshkeetaan (Hoonah). Speaker's English name: J.B. Fawcett. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Tseexwáa. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Toos' (Shark). Speaker's Clan: Wooshkeetaan (Hoonah). Speaker's English name: Mrs. J.C. Johnson. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kaaxwaan. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Cheech (Porpoise). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Telling of stories and songs: the story of Glacier Bay, Gusuwaayei gunaanaa song, spiritual songs, (shaman songs), cry song, Lukaax.ádi and Chookaneidí songs.

Speaker's English name: Frank Williams. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Koodénahaa. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Gaanax.ádi (Ketchikan). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: English/Tlingit. Location recorded: Anchorage, Alaska. Recorded by: Jeff Leer. Description of contents: Jeff Leer interviews Frank Williams in both English and Tlingit.

Speaker's English name: Burt Dennis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Aankadaxtseen. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Lukaax.ádi (Devil's Thumb Mt). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description: Bert tells how he was being enticed (tricked) by Kooshdaa, and of a Chilkoot village that was totally wiped out by an avalanche, and all of his family Lukaax.ádi died. He tells about Talkú near Devil's Thumb Mt near Wrangell. Kooshdaa Hit Shaa Hit.

Speaker's English name: Burt and Marion Dennis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Aankadaxtseen. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Lukaax.ádi (Devil's Thumb Mt). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: English/Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description: Anniversary party; Speech, song, good times for Bert and Marion Dennis.

Speaker's English name: Burt and Marion Dennis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Aankadaxtseen. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Lukaax.ádi (Devil's Thumb Mt). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: English/Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description: Anniversary party, private singing group; Continuing celebrating. Kaagwaantaan singing and dancing.

scopecontent.p: Speaker's English name: Marion Dennis and Jenny Marks. Language: English/Tlingit. Location recorded: Haines, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description: Anniversary party, private singing group; Tlingit Salvation Army songs.

Speaker's English name: Jim Fox. Speaker's Tlingit Name: We.há; Aan yaa laháash. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Gaanax.ádi (Taku). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: English. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: Mrs. (Carol Beery) Davis. Description: Mrs. Davis (and husband) ask Jim Fox about history, his life, and family. (Mr. and Mrs. Davis were the first writers in Juneau, interviewing Tlingit people).

Speaker's English name: Jim Fox. Speaker's Tlingit Name: We.há; Aan yaa laháash. Speaker's Moiety: Yéil (Raven). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Gaanax.ádi (Taku). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Juneau, Alaska. Recorded by: "Presumably Part of Carol Beery Davis collection." Description of contents: Potlatch. Singing from Hoonah group. Potlatch for Yéil, Ch'áak' are giving comfort.

Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Speaker's English name: Willie Marks. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keet Yaanaayí. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: Lukaax.ádi yádi. Language: Tlingit. Location recorded: Anchorage, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Stories and song. Weather, sneezing, and fun with cayenne pepper are some of the topics, as well as Shamanism.

Speaker's English name: Mrs. Peter Johnny. Speaker's Tlingit Name: unknown. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: unknown. Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Speaker's English name: Walter (Babe) Williams; George Davis; Eva Davis; Forrest Dewitt. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Talking about food, money, and life, and storing artifacts in an archive. They talk about living away from their heritage. They also talk about diseases and medicing, modern and Tlingit, as well as hunting and foraging.

Speaker's English name: Walter (Babe) Williams; unknown. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Keidlak'i Éesh. Speaker's Moiety: Ch'áak' (Eagle). Speaker's Crest: Xóots (Brown Bear). Speaker's Clan: Chookaneidí (Hoonah). Father's Clan: unknown. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Fireweed roots, Devil's Club roots, Elderberry roots, more on Tlingit style medicine. Discussion about who record, how to record, and where to store these collections. Short memorial for Henry Bremner.

did.unittitle:
George Davis, Sitka Tradition Bearers' Conference,
April 12, 1978

scopecontent.p: Speaker's English name: George Davis. Speaker's Tlingit Name: Kichnáalx; Lk'aanáaw. Speaker's Moiety: Ts'axweil (Crow) *Raven. Speaker's Crest: S'igeidí (Beaver). Speaker's Clan: Deisheetaan (Angoon). Father's Clan: Kaagwaantaan yádi. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Sitka Tradition Bearers' Conference; George presses to split the group because he fears he will take too long with all the information he knows and he wants to let others talk. Discussion of Tlingit names of months. Recording continues in a restaurant until the end. They talk about the Sitka battle and how the Sitka Russians left.

Speaker's English name: William Nelson; Eva Davis; George Davis; Walter (Babe) Williams; Forrest Dewitt; President of Sitka IRA. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer; unknown. Description of contents: Comforting William Nelson, as he lost a family member during the Conference. Discussing where and how to store recordings and history of Alaska Natives. Explanation of what harvest is available during which months. Also telling about medicine in the wilderness. Mk02200 recording volume is poor. Inaudible until end.

Speaker's English name: Vesta Johnson; Walter (Babe) Williams; George Davis; Charlie Joseph; Austin Hammond. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer; unknown. Description of contents: Tlingit prayers from the Bible and Tlingit Beliefs. Raven story, history before the Flood, coming of the Russians and trading of molasses, rice, and liquor. George tells about subsistence living. Working for Tlingit and Haida wage differences.

Speaker's English name: George Davis; Walter (Babe) Williams; Charlie Joseph; Austin Hammond; Dick Hotch; George James. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer; unknown. Description of contents: Oratory on tradition. Group discussion with three speakers on traditional subjects such as subsistence, healing, land, and language. Continuation: Austin Hammond speaks at the beginning, followed by Dick Hotch, Charlie Joseph and George James. Closing remarks by Walter Babe Williams.

did.unittitle:
Sitka Tradition Bearersʼ Conference: Seminar,
April 14, 1978

scopecontent.p: Speaker's English name: Walter (Babe) Williams; Ellen Hays; George Davis. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Introduction by Walter Babe Williams. Ellen Hays speaks in English about the National Park center, and significance of cultural history in Sitka. George Davis translates for Ellen after she speaks and describes traditional methods of healing, traditional practices, and the significance of recorded cultural history. Closing comments by Walter Babe Williams.

did.unittitle:
Sitka Tradition Bearersʼ Conference: Seminar,
April 12, 1978

scopecontent.p: Speaker's English name: Eva Davis; George Davis; Forrest Dewitt; William Nelson; Nora Dauenhauer. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Side A: Recording starts with Nora Dauenhauer interviewing or recording with Eva Davis. Speaker changes at 10:21, probably to George Davis and to a somewhat informal discussion. Forrest Dewitt speaks briefly at one point. There is more than one conversation going on at a couple of points until about 24:00. Break at 30:19. Side B: Recording begins with a speaker, no introduction. The speaker tells of drinking water from a cup, and a Christian cross forms in the bottom of his cup. He finishes drinking from the cup and has a spiritual experience (speaking in tongues, Russian). He tells of another encounter, hunting with his nephew. They are attacked by a bear, who is finally killled by the speaker with a knife. He finishes his speech with explaining how his experiences have helped him to realize becoming a shaman.

scopecontent.p: Speaker's English name: Eva Davis; George Davis; Forrest Dewitt; Walter Babe Williams; Nora Dauenhauer. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Sitka, Alaska. Recorded by: Nora Marks Dauenhauer. Description of contents: Side A: Recording begins with Forrest Dewitt, no introduction. He speaks about the Juneau area and landmarks, ends at 31:00. George Davis speaks briefly, and posts are elected: chair, vice chair, and secretary. Side B: Recording with dialogue, 1 song. The dialogue is between Nora, Johnny and Willie Marks, though Willie is inaudible.

Speaker's English name: Jessie Dalton; George Dalton; George Jim; unknown speakers. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Angoon, Alaska. Recorded by: unknown. Description of contents: Traditional style of speaking, ceremonial. A ceremonial staff or long cane may have been presented/brought out. The dialogue reflects the manner of speech when such an item is brought out as a matter of protocol. Ceremonial, bringing out of money, giving names. Context of the party is still unknown. Recording may be from the collection of Al Kookesh.

Speaker's English name: George Jim; George Dalton; unknown speakers. Language: Tlingit/English. Location recorded: Angoon, Alaska. Recorded by: unknown. Description of contents: Closing remarks. Several speakers (unknown) speaking in turn. Audio quality diminishes at about 24:30, dialogue and speaker identity are not identifiable. Wax cylinder recordings of songs, ca 1904. Asterisk on track 8 denotes that Nora took a special interest in the transcription ("Tlingit Myths and Texts," p. 390-414), and identified the song as a "Boys' Lullaby" from her childhood, as sung by her parents to her brothers.

Description of contents: J.B. Fawcett. Fall 1969. Recorded at Marks Trail, Juneau, by Nora Florendo (Dauenhauer). This appears to be a copy of #388, as it is labeled "copy," but the contents' insert is slightly different. To be safe, we should migrate both tapes and edit the contents inserts as we do metadata. Sides not noted on the insert. 1) Jenny Marks, Lukaax.ádi song, 2-5) J.B. Fawcett, songs, 6) J.B. Fawcett, Gunanáa, 7) J.B. Fawcett, Yeigak'w shindaa 8), Jenny Marks, Glacier Bay, 9) Story of Lukaax.ádi, names of slaves, 10) story of Ch'eet s'aaxw of Kaagwaantan, 11) story of slaves names, 12) Jenny Marks, Léix'w daak wu.eexí, 13) Jenny Marks, Agwaagadzanaa yaa gwaa hee a hee, 14) Jenny Marks, Yaa naa nei oh, ho.

Description of contents: "'Copy of copy of EC 10' 501 accession of #83-908-F (6038A, 6039A), 1899. Recording of Tlingit on wax cylinder. Anthony Seeger of the Smithsonian Office of Folklife programs brought the wax cylinders to the attention of Dr Michael Krauss of Alaska Native Language Center, who identified the language as Tlingit and made a copy for Nora to transcribe. See HTY 156-161 for transcription and translation; 325ff for notes."

scopecontent.p: Description of contents: "Excerpt copied from Rasmussen Conference tapes, May 1989. See #416-422 for the full conference sequence."

Description of contents: "Making plans for someone who died. He (George Davis) is telling the people, there is a certain way to handle this. He (the important deceased) didn't set a good example of how to do this, though. George then tells how it is on the English side, tells of it in Tlingit. How they built the ANB hall in Angoon. Then how they built a road to the graveyard (from ANB?). He says we are gonna fold away (put up) our culture for a while. He tells of the flood 6000 years ago, then the people came down. Those that are L'uknax.ádi came out by Dry Bay whose crest is L'ook (Coho). Mark 00:40:00 switch to English, and tells where he and his relatives come from, and where they have been. Mark 00:46:00 continues in Tlingit."
